title: Package rename does not check writeability of all resources
description: When attempting to rename a package, the system does not check if all resources within the package are writeable. This can lead to unexpected exceptions.
OB:
To reproduce: 
1. Create a package with a compilation unit (CU) in it. 
2. Make the CU readonly. 
3. Try to rename the package. 

Observers: After the rename operation completes, an unexpected exception dialog is displayed.
SR: To fix this issue, the system should check the writeability of all resources within a package before allowing the rename operation to proceed. If any resource is readonly, the system should prevent the rename operation and display an appropriate error message.
